reviews.review_msg: His accent gets kind of heavy and it becomes hard to understand when he starts talking really fast along with him going on tangents irrelevant to the lecture. The amount of work and reading (about 100 pages per week) required for simply 4% journals is a lot. That along with the midterm where the grading is very strict. Super nice but hard teacher

A really kind and good professor, but tests are very hard and confusing. The tests are reading heavy so if u dont read EVERY reading youre done for. A multiple choice question will be like: what was the main thesis _____'s paper? then u have to choose between 4 identical answers with a few words changed :.) i cried after the final exam.

I took several upper-division classes with Kawasaki including POL 381, and he is arguably one of the best profs: I was able to learn a lot through his knowledgeable lectures and journal assignments. Couldn't agree more with the review written in 2017, that is, "the stuff you learn is extremely practical". He is also caring.
Bro may be Japanese but speaks a lot of Yappanese
Hard course if you are not willing to put in the work.
Funny guy

Caring and knowledgeable professor. A significant amount of material to read however videos are used to further understanding and can be interesting. The midterm was unreasonable and solely used to bring down the class average. Do not expect feedback on assignments. Lectures are interesting and the professor genuinely cares about the students

Terrible criteria for the assignments and has no care for the grading system when marking items. Extremely harsh when it comes to marking in general and the assignments do not need to be that long. His claim is 'write to fill the paper'?!

Has difficulty explaining simple concepts and goes on long tangents that leaves student questions unanswered, lectures are often long and difficult to follow. HIs grading scheme is inconsistent and his criteria for assignments will change without him informing the class. Generally seems understanding and caring but still a very tough marker overall

I took one of his upper level Political Science courses last year and despite the rigor he puts you through, the stuff you learn is extremely practical. I can honestly say my level of academic writing would not be where it is at had I not taken his course. For his lower division courses, however, I had a friend tell me he is actually rather easy,

He isn't a horrible prof and lectures aren't that bad. He requires us to hand in a  journal every week (which require quite a bit of effort), basically a 1000 word essay every week that counts for 1.5% of your grade and he doesn't give any feedback on them which scares me. I liked the class at first but it began to became dreadful after some time.

If you dont mind he's strong accent and put effort, you will do fine. He's generous enough to not easily fail you, but he won't give easy A's either. You will do fine as long as you read EVERY reading and put time to think about those. The thing is, you will do fine in every other courses if you put the kind of effort to do well in HIS class.

The textbook is extremely biased for Japan. The lecture was meaningless to sit there and listen but gotta attend for the attendance. He is deterministic in interpreting political matters, rather than being more objective or neutral. I think he sometimes confuses himself in distinguishing Realism, Constructivism and Liberalism.

At a first year level, Kawasaki cannot be any more forgiving. Understanding that most take this course as an elective he structures his course as such: Attend class, do the weekly response questions (prep for the midterm/final), and complete exams which require no critical thinking and you will do absolutely great. Get to know him beyond ASC101 :).

The textbook is worthless, he says so himself... At least I think that's what he said. Most of the lecture's were completely unintelligible. As far as writing a final paper goes, you better be able to read Japanese, there were nearly NO English language sources for information. If you need to ask him a question... good luck getting an answer.
he's aight... just memorize EVERYTHING off the worksheets and you'll be good for the midterm and final
this guy takes an attendence everyday by handing out signing cards and it will reflect on ur mark..... be aware
A very witty, funny prof. I really enjoyed his Japanese politics class. Highly recommended.

You can tell he enjoys teaching. Can be funny but mostly very dry. I hate how he runs the class like high-school. Takes attendance TWICE to make sure you stay the whole time and doesn't allow food. Unnecessary since you can pass just by taking notes from the book. Make sure you do the key terms from his handouts!! And you'll be just fine.

Course consisted of two tests and marks for attendance. The 3 hour lectures were BORING to say the least. Pretty much spend most of the semester memorizing the hand-out given out and you'll be fine. The book isn't really used besides background reading. A very small portion of the book material is tested.

I dreaded this class every week and couldn't wait to leave 5 mins into the class. He can't communicate information well and is just plain bad at teaching. Can't believe he's the director of ASC!!! I want to drop my ASC Extended Minor because of him. Anyone else can replace him and be 100x better.

Extremely boring class and terrible professor. He gives no breaks and when someone gets up to use the washroom he completely chews them out for it. Completely crazy. Didn't help me at all when I went to his office hours. Don't take his courses!

he's a super super funny prof!! he played sailormoon and doraemon during the break so we could relax! he does have a thick accent but most of the time its not tat hard to understand what he's saying..easy materials..just do the weekly assignments and memorize his handout..i'd say the lowest u can get is a B!

this is an extremely easy class! definitely a GPA booster!! all u have to do is to attend all his lectures and do 10 weekly statements and u get 20% free!!! midterm and final are 40% each!! but all u have to do is to memorize brief dates and u will definitely ace the exam!! everyone take this class!!

Refer to the post below. I literally Laugh Out Loud, as the guy left the exam room. Anywayz, Tsuyoshi gives easy exams, and jokes around in class. Though his lecture are exetremly boring, the notes he gives u are mandatory on the exam so be prepare to memorize it=)

Cool guy! Very funny too! He was giving this guy late to the finals a hard time taking his jacket and all haha...turned out the student was at the wrong exam anyways LOL. Exams were super fair. Attendance very important for the marks. Though accent is a bit heavy, it's nothing to worry about. This prof is very knowledgeable.

Highly reccomend!! Easy course with easy midterm/final and 10 weekly assignments(check upon completion) IF you are looking for a booster, this is the right choice, though his lectures are boring, however, you'll be surprised at easiness of this introductory course =)
Very unorganized, very boring class. Don't ever take this class. You will bound to fall asleep and cannot hear him at all with his heavy accent.BRUTAL CLASS

I had professor Kawasaki about two years ago and his was one of the best courses I've ever taken.  He's the most helpful professor in the department who wants to genuinely help his students learn and improve their own writing skills.  I'm at York now and I don't think I would be here if it were not for my dear mentor.

His lectures are long and boring most of the time without a break in between.  He is unclear about the information most of the time and goes on and on about the same thing.  His voice also puts people to sleep, even the people sitting right up front.
He's a really nice prof. Very helpful when you ask questions during tutorials. Also, it's the easiest class I ever took.  It was my only A+ that I got at SFU.  The course content is fun too.
No Comments

10 weekly statements, 1 mt & 1 final.  Lectures are pretty long, w/no breaks.  Mt is a breeze if u memorize the handout, & u'll get an A for sure if u go over the txt.  The final, however, was harder than i had expected!  Overall, pretty interesting stuff to learn & a funny prof ><!
boring lecture, strong accents, lots of reading but not nesscary, just study for the handout

memorize syllabus; complete assignments; go to lecture is all you need for his asc 101 class.. he gives completion mark for assignments.. exams are easy.. he has heavy accent. lecture is a bit boring. may fall asleep sometimes

readings are hard, but i guess not necessary.  just take good notes, memorize the syllabus and other notes he gives....his accent wasn't hard to understand, at least not to me...it will be an enjoyable class if you are interested in the subject.  give it a shot, not bad
cool teacher

make sure you're interested in the subject/course material.  be prepared to take good notes.  then memorize the notes he's given and your notes.  then skim the textbook.  then ace the class. i onl got a B. ****. but otherwise you should be fine
Extremely funny and entertaining.  Objectives of the course and work load is apparent.

He makes you write a one page paper for the tutorial every week to count for the participation marks. His lectures are boring most of the time, and it will take a while to understand his accent.His exam is ok. His class is not hard, is just annoying with those paper every week.
He is a cool guy~ Seem to know a lot on what he is teaching~ Go off topic durin lecture sometimes~ but gives easy exams~
Great guy, enthusiastic and takes a genuine interest in his students.  Very smart and an entertaining lecturer.  One of the best profs I've had.
It was a fun course!  You just need to read his notes and you'll get an A for the course.  Don't even bother reading the text!

Good luck listening to what this egghead has to say. Very unhelpful, arguable and confusing...I spent most of my time frustrated with him concerning how he wants resaerch papers and assignments done. Speaka gooda engrish aneewun???
Lectures were absolutely unfocussed. Outdated text. Learned absolutely nothing. Waste of time and money. Stay away if you want to learn, stay if you want to snoooooze.

super nice prof, super easie final exams, i didnt even bother to open the book and got a B- His accent is somehow a problem but not as think as a typical japanese, trust me !! it's as severe as u think that it is !!! ^_^
Super easy. Got an a for no effort..haha....attendance mark a bonus (basically just sleep through the class)..final exam is hilariously easy
Seems nice, but is actually quite disagreeable
esay course, there's no need to read the text, memorize syllabus and u'll do fine...there's no way u can understand him with his heavy japanese accent...
very difficult course.  had to write a long long essay at the end.  nice guy.  u can ask him question and he'll answer u but u'll never understand what he said.
Nice guy.  Hard class.
This guy is soooo smart and well read.  Yes he has an accent... perhaps people should listen closer, he's got so much to say.  A REALLY intresting class.
Hard to understand his accent. And so many readings every week. Wanna to skip his class every week.
He's not good at teaching. Accent difficult to understand. (I don't usually pick on people's accent but his is really thick) The final is easy though.
He's a very nice prof
his english is very hard to understand..~
enthusiastic but thick accent makes him difficult to understand.
